chapter.title: Lab Controller
chapter.para: Beaker uses Lab Controllers to manage it's system inventory. The Lab Controller has to sit on a seperate machine to Beaker. Is this still valid? To install a Lab Controller, open a terminal on the Labcontroller and clone a copy of the repository as in .

These dependencies are needed to make the rpm.
$ sudo yum -y install python-setuptools-devel $ sudo yum -y install rpm-build python-devel TurboGears
Now create the rpm
$ make snaparchive $ sudo make rpms
Now install the Lab Controller rpm
$ sudo yum localinstall rpm-build/noarch/beaker-lab-controller-0.5.31-3.fc11.noarch.rpm --nogpgfails without switching gpg off
